Business: One way to build and maintain relationships is with greetings / seasonal cards. It is important to be a good correspondent as the Japanese hold this in high esteem.
Punctuality is important. Arrive on time for meetings and expect your Japanese colleagues will do the same.
It is best to telephone for an appointment rather than send a letter, fax, email

Fine: The honoured gues or the eldest is the first person to begin eating
Never point your chopsticks. Do not peirce your food with chopsticks

Casual: Don't be surprised if your Japanese colleagues slurp their noodles and soup
